definition: scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack

sentences.english: Don't form an undisciplined way of life.
sentences.chinese: 不要养成散漫的生活作风。

sentences.english: Talkative and inattentive in class, should try to work harder.
sentences.chinese: 上课多言散漫，应用功学习。

sentences.english: Discursivity, discourse: that's what I forgot to talk about last time.
sentences.chinese: 上节课我忘了讲散漫性和话语。

sentences.english: Many entrepreneurs acknowledge that local leaders’ laxity is deliberate.
sentences.chinese: 许多企业家认为，当地领导的散漫是他们的自由。

sentences.english: I know you're used to loosed-goosey.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你们过去散漫惯了。

sentences.english: The boy is so free and easy that he is always absent from school.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子太自由散漫以致经常旷课。
他散漫安闲地度过夏天。
双鱼座是非常自由散漫的人。

sentences.english: But so far his performance during the financial crisis has been desultory .
sentences.chinese: 但是到目前为止他的在金融危机期间的表现是散漫的。

sentences.english: During her son"s absence, Johnathan has become more undisciplined than Linda would like."
sentences.chinese: 在她儿子的缺席，乔纳森已成为比琳达要更散漫。

sentences.english: As a result, what we get from art is not an experience but something slack and discursive.
sentences.chinese: 这使得我们对艺术的经验变得松弛和散漫。

sentences.english: This is 1 kind to breach discipline, freedom the false behavior of the desultoriness.
sentences.chinese: 这是一种违反纪律，自由散漫的错误行为。

sentences.english: So, I'll be a little looser now where I put things.
sentences.chinese: 我有点散漫的，我把东西放在。

sentences.english: Everything just obeys orders, obey discipline, there is no freedom desultoriness .
sentences.chinese: 一切都只是服从命令，遵守纪律，没有自由散漫。

definition: lit. one strong beat and one weak beats in a measure of music (two beats in the bar) (idiom); fig. follow a prescribed pattern to the letter/scrupulous attention to detail
free and unconstrained (idiom); unfettered/unbuttoned/without care or worries
